The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

Comments_List: I learned more about Japanese culture and the language. This class was really helpful and has motivated me to take higher level Japanese.
I further polished my Japanese by learning more kanji characters, grammar patterns and doing more oral practice.
I learned more Japanese, and that's always great. Also got more cultural insight, which was fascinating.
Some of the material seems unnecessary and excessive; course load can feel overbearing
I was always involved and part of discussions which really made me more confident in my speaking skills.

Not really any weaknesses to report. The instruction is very friendly, fun, and informative. The homework is relevant and really aids in comprehension and retention. The workload is very doable once you get used to it.
Of course! Anyone who wants to finish off L3 with L4 would be grateful for the opportunity
Yes, if a student has taking L1/L2/L3 and want to further their skills, L4 is a great class to take to continue the Japanese learning program.
I would. This is an excellent course designated for intensive language study, Teachers are very nice and patient.

Japanese is a great language. If you're learning language for utility it may not be your first choice, but if you are already curious about Japan or want to study a particularly beautiful language, I think it's very worth continuing on to the higher levels.
